LuaFunction.Name: NOBN_ocs_getRollFromCant()
LuaFunction.Description: Returns a roll angle deduced from an OCS wire alignment's cant. NB! Cant is interpreted as decimal degrees CW/CCW for non-tracks.
LuaFunction.Formula: function NOBN_ocs_getRollFromCant(where) --If called to express e.g. wire clamps or sweeping a contact wire, then '_position' is provided by RC, sampled along the alignment. if where == nil then ai = getAlignmentInfo() else ai = getAlignmentInfo(where) end angleInDecimalDegrees = ai.Cant -- NB! Cant is interpreted as decimal degrees CW/CCW for non-tracks. if (RC__isNan(angleInDecimalDegrees)) then return 0,_info("UNFINISHED - No cant (to be interpreted as an angle in decimal degrees) data in non-track alignment, assuming zero cant.") elseif angleInDecimalDegrees == 0 then return 0 else -- Cant is measured in millimeter superelevation, with rotation clockwise or counterclockwise in the track's direction -- Assume that only one rail is lifted at a time. cr = tostring(ai.CantRotation) if cr:upper() == "CW" then return angleInDecimalDegrees elseif cr:upper() == "CCW" then return -angleInDecimalDegrees else return 45,_error,_info("Bad cant rotation data ["..CantRotation.."], assuming 90 degrees roll as a visual warning.") end end end

CustomAttribute.Name: WireMaterial
CustomAttribute.Description: The overhead catenary system (OCS) contact wire material [Ri 100 | RiS 100 | Ri 120 | RiS 120].

LuaFunction.Name: _EH_KTL_Layer()
LuaFunction.Description: Obtains the CAD system layer name for the catenary wire, based on its Variant.
LuaFunction.Formula: function _EH_KTL_Layer() if Variant:match("ikke kjørbar") then return "JBTKL_EH_KTL_Kontaktledning_Ikke_kjørbar" else return "JBTKL_EH_KTL_Kontaktledning_Kjørbar" end end

LuaFunction.Name: _EH_KTL_Linetype()
LuaFunction.Description: Obtains the CAD system linetype (continuous / dashed) for the catenary wire, based on its Variant.
LuaFunction.Formula: function _EH_KTL_Linetype() if Variant:match("ikke kjørbar") then return "RC-DASHED" else return "Continuous" end end

LuaFunction.Name: _EH_KTL_Color()
LuaFunction.Description: Obtains the CAD system color for the catenary wire, based on its Variant. If your CAD system uses a color table translator, then colors may indirectly control line color and width in print.
LuaFunction.Formula: function _EH_KTL_Color() if Variant:match("Sort") then return "White" elseif Variant:match("Blå") then return "30,144,255" elseif Variant:match("Lilla") then return "148,0,211" elseif Variant:match("Rød") then return "252,10,28" elseif Variant:match("Brun") then return "139,69,19" elseif Variant:match("Oransje") then return "255,140,0" elseif Variant:match("Grønn") then return "50,205,50" end end

LuaFunction.Name: _EH_KTL_Lineweight()
LuaFunction.Description: Obtains the CAD system lineweight (line width in print) for the catenary wire, based on its Variant.
LuaFunction.Formula: --AutoCAD needs lineweights to be of the form "x.yy mm": function _EH_KTL_Lineweight() if Variant:match("Sort") then return "0.35 mm" else return "0.40 mm" end end

CustomAttribute.Name: WireMaterial
CustomAttribute.Description: The overhead catenary system (OCS) support (catenary/dropper/stich/fix/'Z') wire material [Bz II 50/19 | Bz II 70/19 | Bz II 50/19 isolert].

LuaFunction.Name: _EH_KLO_code()
LuaFunction.Description: Obtains the code for the OCS catenary wire supsension system component, inherited from the associated contact wire, through the 'Er oppheng for kontaktledning' relation.
LuaFunction.Formula: function _EH_KLO_code() r = Relations["Er oppheng for kontaktledning"]:filter(function (x) return x.visible end) if getCollectionLength(r) == 0 then return "UNFINISHED - Relate OCS suspension wires with 'Er oppheng for kontaktledning' to its contact wire.",notice else return r[0].code end end

LuaFunction.Name: _EH_KLO_name()
LuaFunction.Description: Obtains the name for the OCS catenary wire suspension system component, from its 'code'.
LuaFunction.Formula: function _EH_KLO_name() --Assume that each wire part has been related to the contact wire through a relation if Variant == "Bæreline" then return "Bl."..code elseif Variant == "Hengetråd" then return "Ht."..code elseif Variant == "Y-line" then return "Yl."..code elseif Variant == "Fixline" then return "Fl."..code elseif Variant == "Z-line" then return "Zl."..code elseif Variant == "Bardun" then return "Bar."..code elseif Variant == "Strever" then return "Str."..code else return _error,"Bad contact wire support Variant ["..Variant.."]." end end

CustomAttribute.Name: WireType
CustomAttribute.Description: The earthing wire type (ewt) [6/16/25/35/50/70/95/120 mm2 Cu], or aluminum corresponding to the copper conductivities.

CustomAttribute.Name: Sheath
CustomAttribute.Description: The earthing wire sheath type [KHF | UX | TXXI | IX], where KFH:naked conductor for air suspension, UX:insulated for object earthing, TXXI:connecting tracks in tunnels (Cl-free, flame retardant), IX:insulated for indoor or outdoor object earthing. Other Nexans abbreviations are:G:'glødet', H:'hardtrukket', F:'flertrådet'.

LuaFunction.Name: _EH_MAS_non_yoke_mast_code()
LuaFunction.Description: Obtains the code for the OCS mast, as a concatenation of the mast's reference mileage km-value and the current 'seq' local variable.

LuaFunction.Name: _EH_MAS_SpanLength()
LuaFunction.Description: Returns the shortest span length [m] between this catenary mast and its related next mast (at higher reference mileage value).
LuaFunction.Formula: function _EH_MAS_SpanLength() local s = "Neste kl-mast/hengemast_i_åk" local r,n = RC__getCollectionOfRelatedObjects(s) if n == 0 then return 0,_info("UNFINISHED - Relate with '"..s.."' to next OCS mast (at a higher reference mileage), otherwise span length cannot be computed.") else local d,closest,i,dist d = math.huge closest = "(none)" --Closest mast's code for i = 0,n-1 do --Assume no chain break here... dist = math.abs(r[i].ReferenceMileage - ReferenceMileage) if dist < d then d = dist closest = r[i].code end end return string.format("%.03f",d),_info(RC__round(d,3).." span length deduced from mast "..this.code.." to "..closest..".") end end

LuaFunction.Name: _EH_MAS_SpanLengthDisplay()
LuaFunction.Description: Returns the shortest span length [m].
LuaFunction.Formula: function _EH_MAS_SpanLengthDisplay() local sl = getPropertyValue("SpanLength") --Look for nearby masts/suspension masts: local npo1 = getNearbyPointObjects2D(3.0,"EH-MAS KL-mast") local np2 = getNearbyPointObjects2D(3.0,"EH-MAS Åk-hengemast") local npo = getUnionOfCollections({npo1},{npo2}) for i = 0, npo.count-1 do obj = npo[i] osl = getPropertyValue(obj.SpanLength) --If a nearby mast belongs to same track but is located at a higher mileage (closer to next mast [at higher mileage]), then suppress showing spanlength for this mast... if (obj.Alignment.id == this.Alignment.id) and (obj.ReferenceMileage > this.ReferenceMileage) and (string.format("%.01f",osl) == string.format("%.01f",sl)) then return "",_info("Spanlength display intentionally suppressed due to other prevailing spanlength.") end end if math.abs(sl) > 4e-4 then return string.format("-%.01f-",sl) else return "",_info("Very small spanlengths are not shown.") end end

LuaFunction.Name: _EH_MAS_SpanLength2()
LuaFunction.Description: Returns the second shortest span length [m] between this catenary mast and its related next mast (at higher reference mileage value).
LuaFunction.Formula: function _EH_MAS_SpanLength2() local s = "Neste kl-mast/hengemast_i_åk" local r,n = RC__getCollectionOfRelatedObjects(s) if n == 0 or n == 1 then return 0,_info("No second spanlength.") else -- n >= 2: local d,d2,closest,closest2,i,dist d = math.huge d2 = math.huge closest = "(none)" --Closest mast's code closest2 = "(none)" --Second closest mast's code for i = 0,n-1 do --Assume no chain break here... dist = math.abs(r[i].ReferenceMileage - ReferenceMileage) if dist < d then d2 = d closest2 = closest d = dist closest = r[i].code elseif dist < d2 then d2 = dist closest2 = r[i].code end end return string.format("%.03f",d2),_info(RC__round(d2,3).." span length deduced from mast "..this.code.." to "..closest2..".") end end

LuaFunction.Name: _EH_MAS_SpanLengthDisplay2()
LuaFunction.Description: Returns the second shortest span length [m].
LuaFunction.Formula: function _EH_MAS_SpanLengthDisplay2() local sl2 = getPropertyValue("SpanLength2") --Look other nearby masts/suspension masts: local npo1 = getNearbyPointObjects2D(3.0,"EH-MAS KL-mast") local np2 = getNearbyPointObjects2D(3.0,"EH-MAS Åk-hengemast") local npo = getUnionOfCollections({npo1},{npo2}) for i = 0, npo.count-1 do obj = npo[i] osl = getPropertyValue(obj.SpanLength) --If a nearby mast belongs to same track but is located at a higher mileage (closer to next mast [at higher mileage]), then suppress showing spanlength for this mast... if (obj.Alignment.id == this.Alignment.id) and (obj.ReferenceMileage > this.ReferenceMileage) and (string.format("%.01f",osl) == string.format("%.01f",sl)) then return "",_info("Spanlength display intentionally suppressed due to other prevailing spanlength.") end end if math.abs(sl2) > 4e-4 then return string.format("-%.01f-",sl2) else return "",_info("Very small spanlengths are not shown.") end end

LuaFunction.Name: _EH_MAS_SpanLengthTextOffset()
LuaFunction.Description: Returns an offset vector for the shortest span length custom text attribute, to place the text between its two masts.
LuaFunction.Formula: function _EH_MAS_SpanLengthTextOffset() local r,n = RC__getCollectionOfRelatedObjects("Neste kl-mast/hengemast_i_åk") if n == 0 then return 0,0 else local d,closest,i,closestMastCoords,moveVector d = math.huge closest = r[0] for i = 0,n-1 do -- TODO: Use distance() along path instead - but objects need not belong to tracks with a path between them... :-( dist = math.abs(r[i].ReferenceMileage - ReferenceMileage) if dist < d then d = dist closest = r[i] end end closestMastCoords = closest.geoCoord moveVector = {(closestMastCoords.X - geoCoord.X)/2, (closestMastCoords.Y - geoCoord.Y)/2, 0} return moveVector end end

LuaFunction.Name: _EH_MAS_SpanLengthTextOffset2()
LuaFunction.Description: Returns an offset vector for the second shortest span length custom text attribute, to place the text between its two masts.
LuaFunction.Formula: function _EH_MAS_SpanLengthTextOffset2() local r,n = RC__getCollectionOfRelatedObjects("Neste kl-mast/hengemast_i_åk") if n == 0 or n == 1 then return 0,0 else local d,d2,closest,closest2,i,secondClosestMastCoords,moveVector d = math.huge d2 = math.huge closest = r[0] for i = 0,n-1 do -- TODO: Use distance() along path instead - but objects need not belong to tracks with a path between them... :-( dist = math.abs(r[i].ReferenceMileage - ReferenceMileage) if dist < d then d2 = d closest2 = closest d = dist closest = r[i] elseif dist < d2 then d2 = dist closest2 = r[i] end end secondClosestMastCoords = closest2.geoCoord moveVector = {(secondClosestMastCoords.X - geoCoord.X)/2, (secondClosestMastCoords.Y - geoCoord.Y)/2, 0} return moveVector end end

CustomAttribute.Name: OcsMastProfile

CustomAttribute.Name: OcsMastheight
CustomAttribute.Description: The overhead catenary system (OCS) mast height (omh) [mm], given in predefined lengths in 100 millimeter steps.

CustomAttribute.Name: NewOrExisting
CustomAttribute.Description: The overhead catenary system (OCS) mast's age [Ny | Eksisterende].

CustomAttribute.Name: SpanLength
CustomAttribute.Description: The span length (sl) [m] denotes the distance traveled along the associated alignment's reference alignment (projected onto the XY plane) from this mast to the closest next mast, related using 'Neste kl-mast/hengemast_i_åk'/'Forrige kl-mast/hengemast_i_åk'.

CustomAttribute.Name: SpanLengthDisplay
CustomAttribute.Description: The span length value [m] being displayed close to the OCS mast.

CustomAttribute.Name: SpanLength2
CustomAttribute.Description: The span length 2 (sl) [m] denotes the distance traveled along the associated alignment's reference alignment (projected onto the XY plane) from this mast to the second closest next mast, related using 'Neste kl-mast/hengemast_i_åk'/'Forrige kl-mast/hengemast_i_åk'.

CustomAttribute.Name: SpanLengthDisplay2
CustomAttribute.Description: The span length 2 value [m] being displayed close to the OCS mast, rounded to the closest integer value.

LuaFunction.Description: Returns an angular offset, to orient the (ordinary) mast colinear with its yoke (if any).

LuaFunction.Name: _EH_MAS_KlMast_Model3DName()
LuaFunction.Description: Obtains the 'Model3DName' for this KL mast.
LuaFunction.Formula: function _EH_MAS_KlMast_Model3DName() if Variant:match("Bjelkemast") then return "NO-BN-3D-EH-MAS-BJELKEMAST-" ..OcsMastProfile .."-" ..OcsMastheight elseif Variant:match("GMB-mast") then --TODO: Få ekte data for GMB-mastene return "NO-BN-3D-EH-MAS-GMBMAST-" ..OcsMastProfile .."-" ..OcsMastheight --TODO: Lage 3D GMB-master elseif Variant:match("H-mast") then return "NO-BN-3D-EH-MAS-GITTERMAST-" ..OcsMastProfile .."-" ..OcsMastheight elseif Variant:match("B-mast") then return "NO-BN-3D-EH-MAS-GITTERMAST-" ..OcsMastProfile .."-" ..OcsMastheight elseif Variant:match("Betongmast") then return "NO-BN-3D-EH-MAS-BETONGMAST-" ..OcsMastProfile .."-" ..OcsMastheight elseif Variant:match("Tremast") then return "NO-BN-3D-EH-MAS-TREMAST-" ..OcsMastProfile .."-" ..OcsMastheight else return "Ukjent Variant ["..Variant.."]",_warning end end

SymbolDefinition.BlockNameFormat: NO-BN-2D-JBTKL-MAST {% if Variant == 'Bjelkemast' %}BJELKEMAST {% elsif Variant == 'GMB-mast' %}GMBMAST {% elsif Variant == 'H-mast' %}GITTERMAST-H {% elsif Variant == 'B-mast' %}GITTERMAST-B {% elsif Variant == 'Betongmast' %}BETONGMAST {% elsif Variant == 'Tremast' %}TREMAST {% else %}BAD_VARIANT {% endif %}

LuaFunction.Name: _EH_MAS_tunnel_suspension_mast_RelativeElevation()
LuaFunction.Description: Returns the relative elevation for a ocs mast suspended from a yoke, based on the yoke's type and relative elevation.
LuaFunction.Formula: function _EH_MAS_tunnel_suspension_mast_RelativeElevation() s = "Har kl-fundament" r,n = RC__getCollectionOfRelatedObjects(s) if n == 0 then -- Belongs to a bridge underside (with no bolt group/foundation object), or has not (yet) received its bolt group relation: return 7.0,_info( "UNFINISHED - Relate mast with 'Har kl-fundament' to OCS ceiling bolt group, or delete formula and replace by actual relative height if bolt group is irrelevant.") else -- Has bolt group: return r[0].RelativeElevation,_info("Value obtained from foundation '"..RC__identify(r[0]).."'.") end end

LuaFunction.Name: _EH_MAS_tunnel_mast_Model3dName()
LuaFunction.Description: Obtains the 'Model3DName' for this OCS suspension mast.
LuaFunction.Formula: function _EH_MAS_tunnel_mast_Model3dName() if Variant:match("Hengemast i tunnel") ~= nil then if (OcsMastProfile == "Sirkulær, Ø120") then return "NO-BN-3D-EH-MAS-HENGEMAST-I-TUNNEL-SIRKULÆR-Ø120" elseif (OcsMastProfile == "Kvadratisk, 100x100") then return "NO-BN-3D-EH-MAS-HENGEMAST-I-TUNNEL-REKTANGULÆR-100x100" elseif (OcsMastProfile == "Rektangulær, 150x100") then return "NO-BN-3D-EH-MAS-HENGEMAST-I-TUNNEL-REKTANGULÆR-150x100" elseif (OcsMastProfile == "Rektangulær, 200x100") then return "NO-BN-3D-EH-MAS-HENGEMAST-I-TUNNEL-REKTANGULÆR-200x100" end elseif Variant:match("Hengemast Cariboni") ~= nil then if (OcsMastProfile == "Kvadratisk, 100x100") then return "NO-BN-3D-EH-MAS-HENGEMAST-I-TUNNEL-REKTANGULÆR-100x100" elseif (OcsMastProfile == "Rektangulær, 150x100") then return "NO-BN-3D-EH-MAS-HENGEMAST-I-TUNNEL-REKTANGULÆR-150x100" end else return "Bad OCS suspension mast Variant ["..Variant.."].",_warning end end

LuaFunction.Name: _EH_MAS_yoke_suspension_mast_Variant()
LuaFunction.Description: Obtains the Variant for this OCS suspension mast.

LuaFunction.Name: _EH_MAS_yoke_suspension_mast_code()
LuaFunction.Description: Obtains the code for this OCS suspension mast.
LuaFunction.Formula:
function _EH_MAS_yoke_suspension_mast_code() local yokeRelation = "Er hengemast i åk" local yokes, nYokes = RC__getCollectionOfRelatedObjects(yokeRelation) if nYokes == 0 then return "UNFINISHED - Relate with '"..yokeRelation.."'." elseif nYokes > 1 then return _warning,"UNFINISHED - Suspended OCS mast belongs to more than one yoke " .." - remove unintended relations '"..yokeRelation.."' or adjust the active stage using layer names." else --One yoke: local supportMastRelation = "Er åk holdt oppe av kl-mast" local supportMasts, nSupportMasts = RC__getCollectionOfRelatedObjects(supportMastRelation,yokes[0]) if nSupportMasts == 0 then return "UNFINISHED - Cannot deduce suspended OCS mast name since yoke '"..RC__identify(yokes[0]).."' has no support mast yet." else --Find the reference support mast - being closest to the yoke's own insertion point (there may be many yoke support masts): local i local shortestDist = math.huge local referenceSupportMast = nil for i = 0,nSupportMasts-1 do local newDist = RC__getDistance2D(yokes[0].geoCoord,supportMasts[i].geoCoord) if newDist < shortestDist then shortestDist = newDist referenceSupportMast = i end end
--Start suspended mast's code with support mast's code: local suspendedMastCode = supportMasts[referenceSupportMast].code
--Assign sequence number to this suspended OCS mast (counted from the support mast closest to yoke's insertion point): local suspendedMastRelation = "Er åk for hengemast_i_åk" local suspendedMasts, nSuspendedMasts = RC__getCollectionOfRelatedObjects(suspendedMastRelation,yokes[0])
local sequenceNumber = 1 local myDistance = RC__getDistance2D(supportMasts[referenceSupportMast].geoCoord,this.geoCoord) for i = 0,nSuspendedMasts-1 do local otherDistance = RC__getDistance2D(supportMasts[referenceSupportMast].geoCoord,suspendedMasts[i].geoCoord) if (suspendedMasts[i].id ~= this.id) then if otherDistance < myDistance then sequenceNumber = sequenceNumber + 1 end end end return supportMasts[referenceSupportMast].code..string.format("-%02d",sequenceNumber), _info("Code deduced from yoke '"..yokes[0].code.."' and its related components.") end end end

LuaFunction.Name: _EH_MAS_yoke_suspension_mast_Mileage()
LuaFunction.Description: Deduces the yoke suspension mast's mileage, based on its relation to a yoke/galley and this one's support mast(s).
LuaFunction.Formula:
function _EH_MAS_yoke_suspension_mast_Mileage() local ys = "Er hengemast i åk" local yr,yn = RC__getCollectionOfRelatedObjects(ys) if yn == 0 then return getPropertyValue("Mileage"),_info("UNFINISHED - Relate to yoke/galley with '"..ys.."' to set mileage automatically.")
elseif yn > 1 then return getPropertyValue("Mileage"), _info("ERROR - Suspension mast is related to more than one yoke ("..RC__identify(yr[0])..", "..RC__identify(yr[1])..").")
else --yn == 1
local s = "Er åk holdt oppe av kl-mast" local r,n = RC__getCollectionOfRelatedObjects(s,yr[0]) if n == 0 then return RC__getMileageFromRelatedObject(s), _info("Mileage deduced from yoke/galley lacking support mast(s) '"..RC__identify(yr[0]).."'.")
elseif n == 1 then --Galley: return RC__getMileageFromRelatedObject(s),_info("Mileage deduced from support mast '"..RC__identify(r[0]).."'.")
elseif n >= 2 then --Our mast is suspended from a yoke yr[0] being supported by OCS masts r[0] and r[1]: local m1 = r[0] local m2 = r[1] -- Not needed: if RC__getDistance2D(this,m1) > RC__getDistance2D(this,m2) then m1,m2 = m2,m1 end local x1 = m1.geoCoord.X local y1 = m1.geoCoord.Y local dx = m2.geoCoord.X - x1 local dy = m2.geoCoord.Y - y1
--Find point Q on the straight line betweeen m1 and m2 with the yoke suspension mast's specified DistanceToAlignment: function err(t) local Qx = x1+t*dx local Qy = y1+t*dy return getAlignmentInfo(Alignment.id,Qx,Qy).DistanceToAlignment - this.DistanceToAlignment end local tq = getZeros(err,{tolerance = 1e-4, interval = {0,1}, timeLimit = 3})[0] local Qx = x1 + tq*dx local Qy = y1 + tq*dy return getAlignmentInfo(Alignment.id,Qx,Qy).Mileage end end end

LuaFunction.Name: _EH_MAS_yoke_suspension_mast_RelativeElevation()
LuaFunction.Description: Returns the relative elevation for a ocs mast suspended from a yoke, based on the yoke's type and relative elevation.
LuaFunction.Formula: function _EH_MAS_yoke_suspension_mast_RelativeElevation() local s,r,n,e,v s = "Er hengemast i åk" r,n = RC__getCollectionOfRelatedObjects(s) if n == 0 then return 0.0,_info("UNFINISHED - Relate with 'Er hengemast i åk' to its OCS yoke.") else e = (r[0].geoCoord.Z - getAlignmentInfo().Elevation) + 0.10 --Above bottom of yoke v = r[0].Variant if v:match("12") then return e + 0.8 elseif v:match("14") then return e + 1.2 elseif v:match("40") then return e + 0.4 else return 0.0,_error,_info("Bad related OCS yoke '"..RC__identify(r[0]).."' Variant: ["..v.."].") end end end

LuaFunction.Name: _EH_MAS_yoke_suspension_mast_AngularOffset()
LuaFunction.Description: Returns an angular offset, to orient the mast colinear with its yoke (if any).

LuaFunction.Name: _EH_MAS_yoke_suspension_mast_Model3dName()
LuaFunction.Description: Obtains the 'Model3DName' for this OCS suspension mast.
LuaFunction.Formula: function _EH_MAS_yoke_suspension_mast_Model3dName() if Variant:match("12") then return "NO-BN-3D-EH-MAS-HENGEMAST-I-ÅK-TYPE-12-3100" elseif Variant:match("14") then if (OcsMastheight == "3500") then return "NO-BN-3D-EH-MAS-HENGEMAST-I-ÅK-TYPE-14-3500" else return "NO-BN-3D-EH-MAS-HENGEMAST-I-ÅK-TYPE-14-4000" end elseif Variant:match("40") then return "NO-BN-3D-EH-MAS-HENGEMAST-I-ÅK-TYPE-40-3500" else return "Bad OCS suspension mast Variant ["..Variant.."].",_warning end end

CustomAttribute.Name: mc_YokeMastsToBeRefreshed
CustomAttribute.Description: If mast belongs to a yoke (suspended or supporting), then the whole structure will be refreshed.

LuaFunction.Name: _EH_MAS_chkTriggerRelatedObjects()
LuaFunction.Description: Triggers modelchecking in the yoke's masts.
LuaFunction.Formula: function _EH_MAS_chkTriggerRelatedObjects() local yokeRelation = "Er hengemast i åk" local yokes, nYokes = RC__getCollectionOfRelatedObjects(yokeRelation) if nYokes == 0 then return 0,_info("UNFINISHED - Relate with '"..yokeRelation.."'.") elseif nYokes >= 1 then local t = {} local i local s1 = "Er åk holdt oppe av kl-mast" local r1,n1 = RC__getCollectionOfRelatedObjects(s1,yokes[0]) for i = 0,n1-1 do table.insert(t,r1[i]) end s2 = "Er åk for hengemast_i_åk" local r2,n2 = RC__getCollectionOfRelatedObjects(s2,yokes[0]) for i = 0,n2-1 do table.insert(t,r2[i]) end --if true then return nYokes,yokes,n1,r1,n2,r2 end return n1+n2,t,_info(n1+n2.." masts have been refreshed.") end end

SymbolDefinition.BlockNameFormat: NO-BN-2D-JBTKL-HENGEMAST {% if Variant == 'Hengemast i åk type 12' %}I-AAK {% elsif Variant == 'Hengemast i åk type 14' %}I-AAK {% elsif Variant == 'Hengemast i åk type 40' %}I-AAK {% else %}BAD_VARIANT {% endif %}

CustomAttribute.Name: Length
CustomAttribute.Description: The overhead catenary system (OCS) yoke length (oyl), given in predefined lengths in 1 meter steps. Each may be composed of subparts, where the joints may hinder suspension mast mounting.

LuaFunction.Name: _EH_AAK_DistanceToAlignment()
LuaFunction.Description: Returns the distance to alignment for the yoke.
LuaFunction.Formula:
function _EH_AAK_DistanceToAlignment() -- Ref Bane NOR, lærebok "Bygging av kontaktledningsanlegg" Del 2:2, Kap. 14
function _EH_AAK_get_mastDistanceToAlignment(mast) if mast.Alignment == nil then return RightSided and 4e-4 or -4e-4,_warning,_info("Closest OCS support mast is not connected to a track (own alignment).") else local mv = mast.Variant local mp = mast.OcsMastProfile local d if mv:match("Bjelkemast") ~= nil then d = string.sub(mp,4,6)/2000 --Assume mast profile names "HEB200", "HEB220" etc elseif mv:match("GMB-mast") ~= nil then d = string.sub(mp,4,6)/2000 --Assume mast profile names "HEB200", "HEB220" etc TODO: Finn ekte profiler for GMB-mast elseif mv:match("B-mast") ~= nil then d = (mast.OcsMastheight - RelativeElevation) * math.tan(23/1000000) elseif mv:match("H-mast") ~= nil then d = (mast.OcsMastheight - RelativeElevation) * math.tan(1/50000) elseif mv:match("Hengemast") ~= nil then if (mp == 'Sirkulær, Ø120') then d = 0.06 elseif (mp == 'Kvadratisk, 100x100') then d = 0.05 elseif (mp == 'Rektangulær, 150x100') then d = 0.075 elseif (mp == 'Rektangulær, 200x100') then d = 0.1 else return 0,_warning,_info("Bad OCS mast profile ["..mp.."].") end else return 0,_warning,_info("Bad OCS mast variant ["..mv.."].") end -- OCS mast and yoke may belong to different tracks (when OCS mast is located between tracks): mdist = getAlignmentInfo(alignment.id,mast.geoCoord.X,mast.geoCoord.Y).DistanceToAlignment --Distance from center closest OCS mast to yoke's alignment if (mast.RightSided) then if (mast.Alignment.id == Alignment.id) then return mdist-d else return mdist+d end else if (mast.Alignment.id == Alignment.id) then return mdist+d else return mdist-d end end end end --function
local RelationName = "Er åk holdt oppe av kl-mast" local r,n = RC__getCollectionOfRelatedObjects(RelationName) if n == 0 then if Variant == "Utliggeråk" then return getPropertyValue("DistanceToAlignment"),_warning,_info("UNFINISHED: Relate galley to an OCS mast with relation '"..RelationName.."'.") else return getPropertyValue("DistanceToAlignment"),_warning,_info( "UNFINISHED: Relate yoke to OCS mast(s) with relation '"..RelationName.."', or change Variant to galley (Utliggeråk).") end
elseif n == 1 then if Variant == "Utliggeråk" then return _EH_AAK_get_mastDistanceToAlignment(r[0]), _info("Galley yoke (Utliggeråk) extending from mast '"..RC__identify(r[0]).."'.") else return getPropertyValue("DistanceToAlignment"),_warning,_info( "UNFINISHED: Relate yoke to one more OCS mast with relation 'Har åk-mast / kl-mast', or change Variant to galley (Utliggeråk).") end
elseif n >= 2 then local m1 = r[0] local m2 = r[1] if RC__getDistance2D(this,m1) > RC__getDistance2D(this,m2) then m1,m2 = m2,m1 end local d1 = RC__getDistance2D(m1,m2) local L = math.floor(1.500 + d1) --Assume min 0.5 and max 1.5 meter total yoke length overshoot local d2 = 0.5 * (L - d1) --Share overshoot between masts local x1 = m1.geoCoord.X local y1 = m1.geoCoord.Y local x2 = m2.geoCoord.X local y2 = m2.geoCoord.Y local x = x1 - (d2/d1)*(x2-x1) local y = y1 - (d2/d1)*(y2-y1) local info = "Distance to alignment deduced through support mast '"..RC__identify(m1).."' related by '"..RelationName.."'." return getAlignmentInfo(Alignment.id,x,y).DistanceToAlignment,_info(info) end end

LuaFunction.Name: _EH_AAK_Length()
LuaFunction.Description: Returns the length of the yoke, being the mast-mast center distance plus 1.50 meter, rounded down.
LuaFunction.Formula:
function _EH_AAK_Length() -- Ref Bane NOR, lærebok "Bygging av kontaktledningsanlegg" Del 2:2, Kap. 14 local RelationName = "Er åk holdt oppe av kl-mast" local r,n = RC__getCollectionOfRelatedObjects(RelationName) local L if n == 0 then if Variant == "Utliggeråk" then L = "6m" return L,_warning,_info("UNFINISHED: Relate galley to an OCS mast with relation '"..RelationName.."'.") else if Variant == "Type 12" then L = "11m" elseif Variant == "Type 14" then L = "28m" elseif Variant == "Type 40" then L = "10m" end return L,_warning,_info( "UNFINISHED: Relate yoke to OCS mast(s) with relation '"..RelationName.."', or change Variant to galley (Utliggeråk).") end
elseif n == 1 then local m1 = r[0] if Variant == "Utliggeråk" then return "6m",_info("Galley yoke (Utliggeråk) extending from mast "..m1.code..".") else if Variant == "Type 12" then L = "11m" elseif Variant == "Type 14" then L = "28m" elseif Variant == "Type 40" then L = "10m" end return L,_warning,_info( "UNFINISHED: Relate yoke to one more OCS mast with relation 'Har åk-mast / kl-mast', or change Variant to galley (Utliggeråk).") end
elseif n >= 2 then local m1 = r[0] local m2 = r[1] local P1 = m1.geoCoord local P2 = m2.geoCoord local len = RC__getDistance2D(P1,P2) L = math.floor(len + 1.5) if Variant == "Type 12" then if L < 11 then return "11m",_warning,_info("L="..L.." required, but Type 12 yokes can't be shorter than 11 meter. Change to type 40 or galley (Utliggeråk).") elseif L > 33 then return "33m",_warning,_info("L="..L.." required, but Type 12 yokes can't be longer than 33 meter, change to Type 14.") end elseif Variant == "Type 14" then if L < 28 then return "28m",_warning,_info("L="..L.." required, but Type 14 yokes can't be made shorter than 28 meter. Change to Type 12 or 40.") elseif L > 43 then return "43m",_warning,_info("L="..L.." required, but Type 14 yokes can't be made longer than 43 meter.") end elseif Variant == "Type 40" then if L < 10 then return "10m",_warning,_info("L="..L.." required, but Type 40 yokes can't be made shorter than 10 meter. Change to galley (Utliggeråk).") elseif L > 16 then return "16m",_warning,_info("L="..L.." required, but Type 40 yokes can't be made longer than 16 meter, change to Type 12 or 14.") end else return getPropertyValue("Length"),_error,_info("Remove excess yoke support mast(s), or change yoke Variant into Type 12/14/40.") end return L.."m",_info("Length deduced from mast "..m1.code.." and "..m2.code.." ("..RC__round(len,3).." m).") end end

LuaFunction.Name: _EH_AAK_AngularOffset()
LuaFunction.Description: Returns the angular offset needed to orient the yoke between its two masts, or a galley according to its mast.

LuaFunction.Name: _EH_AAK_Mileage()
LuaFunction.Description: Deduces the galley's / yoke's mileage, based on relation to one or two yoke support masts.

LuaFunction.Name: _EH_AAK_Model3DName()
LuaFunction.Description: Returns the yoke's 3D object model name.
LuaFunction.Formula: function _EH_AAK_Model3DName() local t = "NO-BN-3D-EH-AAK-" if Variant == "Type 12" then return t.."TYPE-12-"..Length elseif Variant == "Type 14" then return t.."TYPE-14-"..Length elseif Variant == "Type 40" then return t.."TYPE-40-"..Length elseif Variant == "Utliggeråk" then return t.."UTLIGGERÅK" else return "Bad OCS yoke Variant ["..Variant.."]",_warning end end

LuaFunction.Name: _EH_UTL_StandardValues()
LuaFunction.Description: Returns standard cantilever values table: [cwh]=contact wire height, [sh]=system height, [shmin]=min. sh, [shmax]=max. sh, [lco]=lower console offset from cwh.

LuaFunction.Name: _EH_UTL_ReferenceMileage()
LuaFunction.Description: Returns cantilever's reference mileage, based on its OCS mast's reference mileage. If more cantilevers are located on noe side of the mast, they will arbitrate positions.
LuaFunction.Formula: function _EH_UTL_ReferenceMileage() StandardCantileverSpacing = 0.60 --60 cm separation to allow cantilevers to swing towards each other with temperature movements s = "Tilhører kl-mast/hengemast_i_åk" r,n = RC__getCollectionOfRelatedObjects(s) if n == 0 then if (Alignment == nil) then return 0,_info("UNFINISHED - Relate with '"..s.."' to OCS mast and assign to an 'own aligment'.") else return Mileage == nil and 0 or Mileage,_info("UNFINISHED - Relate with '"..s.."' to OCS mast.") end else mast = r[0] ss = "Er kl-mast for utligger" u,n = RC__getCollectionOfRelatedObjects(ss,mast) --n is the number of cantilevers connected to my OCS mast --Who am I? me = nil for i = 0,n-1 do if id == u[i].id then me = i end end if me == nil then return mast.ReferenceMileage,_warning,_info("Corrupt relation '"..ss.."' to OCS mast - cannot compute position.") end --Anyone else on my side of OCS mast? myLastPal = nil nPals = 0 for i = 0,n-1 do if i ~= me and u[i].alignment.id == alignment.id then myLastPal = i nPals = nPals + 1 end end if nPals == 0 then return mast.ReferenceMileage elseif nPals == 1 then if me < myLastPal then return mast.ReferenceMileage - StandardCantileverSpacing else return mast.ReferenceMileage + StandardCantileverSpacing end else return mast.ReferenceMileage,_warning,_info("Too many ["..(nPals+1).."] cantilevers on same side of OCS mast.") end end end

LuaFunction.Name: _EH_UTL_DistanceToAlignment()
LuaFunction.Description: Returns cantilever's distance to own alignment, based on its OCS mast's type and position. (2020-02-16: Formul does not take into account the angularOffset of the mast.)
LuaFunction.Formula: function _EH_UTL_DistanceToAlignment() if (Alignment == nil) then --If cantilever has no alignment, set to 4e-4 (maintain sideOfAlignment) return RightSided and 4e-4 or -4e-4,_warning,_info("Cantilever is not connected to a track (own alignment).") end local s1 = "Tilhører kl-mast/hengemast_i_åk" local r1,n1 = RC__getCollectionOfRelatedObjects(s1) local s2 = "Tilhører hengemast_i_åk" local r2,n2 = RC__getCollectionOfRelatedObjects(s2) if n1+n2 == 0 then return RightSided and 4e-4 or -4e-4,_warning,_info("Cantilever is missing relation '"..s1.."/"..s2.."' to OCS mast/suspension mast.") else --One of n1 or n2 is greater than zero: if (r1[0].Alignment == nil) and (r2[0].Alignment == nil) then return RightSided and 4e-4 or -4e-4,_warning,_info("Cantilever's OCS mast/suspension mast is not connected to a track (own alignment).") else local mast = (n1 ~= 0) and r1[0] or r2[0] local mv = mast.Variant local mp = mast.OcsMastProfile local d if mv:match("Bjelkemast") ~= nil then d = string.sub(mp,4,6)/2000 --Assume mast profile names "HEB200", "HEB220" etc elseif mv:match("GMB-mast") ~= nil then d = string.sub(mp,4,6)/2000 --Assume mast profile names "HEB200", "HEB220" etc TODO: Finn ekte profiler for GMB-mast elseif mv:match("B-mast") ~= nil then d = (r[0].OcsMastheight - RelativeElevation) * math.tan(23/1000000) elseif mv:match("H-mast") ~= nil then d = (r[0].OcsMastheight - RelativeElevation) * math.tan(1/50000) elseif mv:match("Hengemast") ~= nil then if (mp == 'Sirkulær, Ø120') then d = 0.06 elseif (mp == 'Kvadratisk, 100x100') then d = 0.05 elseif (mp == 'Rektangulær, 150x100') then d = 0.075 elseif (mp == 'Rektangulær, 200x100') then d = 0.1 else return 0,_warning,_info("Bad OCS mast profile ["..mp.."].") end else return 0,_warning,_info("Bad OCS mast variant ["..mv.."].") end -- OCS mast and cantilever may belong to different tracks (when OCS mast is located between tracks): mdist = getAlignmentInfo(alignment.id,mast.geoCoord.X,mast.geoCoord.Y).DistanceToAlignment --Distance from center OCS mast to *cantilever's* alignment if (mast.RightSided) then if (mast.Alignment.id == Alignment.id) then return mdist - d else return mdist + d end else if (mast.Alignment.id == Alignment.id) then return mdist + d else return mdist - d end end end end end

LuaFunction.Name: _EH_UTL_Model3dName()
LuaFunction.Description: Returns cantilever's 3D model name, based on its OCS mast's type and push/pull setting.
LuaFunction.Formula: function _EH_UTL_Model3dName() --TODO: Lage flere 3D-modeller for alle utligger-varianter (men 20, 25 og 35 er veldig like): if (Variant == "System 20A") then if (PushDirection == "Strekk") then return "NO-BN-3D-EH-UTL-SYSTEM-20-STREKK" elseif (PushDirection == "Trykk") then return "NO-BN-3D-EH-UTL-SYSTEM-20-TRYKK" else return "Ukjent Kraftretning ["..PushDirection.."]",_warning end elseif (Variant == "System 20B") then if (PushDirection == "Strekk") then return "NO-BN-3D-EH-UTL-SYSTEM-20-STREKK" elseif (PushDirection == "Trykk") then return "NO-BN-3D-EH-UTL-SYSTEM-20-TRYKK" else return "Ukjent Kraftretning ["..PushDirection.."]",_warning end elseif (Variant == "System 20C") then if (PushDirection == "Strekk") then return "NO-BN-3D-EH-UTL-SYSTEM-20-STREKK" elseif (PushDirection == "Trykk") then return "NO-BN-3D-EH-UTL-SYSTEM-20-TRYKK" else return "Ukjent Kraftretning ["..PushDirection.."]",_warning end elseif (Variant == "System 25") then if (PushDirection == "Strekk") then return "NO-BN-3D-EH-UTL-SYSTEM-20-STREKK" elseif (PushDirection == "Trykk") then return "NO-BN-3D-EH-UTL-SYSTEM-20-TRYKK" else return "Ukjent Kraftretning ["..PushDirection.."]",_warning end elseif (Variant == 'System 35') then if (PushDirection == "Strekk") then return "NO-BN-3D-EH-UTL-SYSTEM-20-STREKK" elseif (PushDirection == "Trykk") then return "NO-BN-3D-EH-UTL-SYSTEM-20-TRYKK" else return "Ukjent Kraftretning ["..PushDirection.."]",_warning end elseif (Variant == "Cariboni") then return "NO-BN-3D-EH-UTL-CARIBONI-UTLIGGER" else return "Ukjent Variant ["..Variant.."].",_warning end end

LuaFunction.Name: _EH_UTL_AddVisual2dAngularOffset()
LuaFunction.Description: Adds 16.7 Decimal Degrees rotation to the cantilever's angle in 2D whenever it is located in a yoke or in a galley, to make it visible in 2D drawings. AngularOffset and 3D rendering are not affected
LuaFunction.Formula: function _EH_UTL_AddVisual2dAngularOffset() s = "Tilhører hengemast_i_åk" r,n = RC__getCollectionOfRelatedObjects(s) if n == 0 then --Cantilevers mounted on yoke support masts are not found and treated here - too complicated for now. return 0 else --Make cantilever "rod" visible even if located under a yoke: return 16.7 --Decimal Degrees end end

CustomAttribute.Name: SubVariant
CustomAttribute.Description: The cantilever subvariant [Standard | Redusert] is 'Standard' when built for its line design speed, and 'Redusert' when built for less tense wires and lesser speeds.

CustomAttribute.Name: PushDirection
CustomAttribute.Description: The cantilever push direction (cpd) [Strekk | Trykk] is denoted 'Strekk' if the cantilever pulls the contact wire towards the cantilever console(s), and 'Trykk' if it pushes it away.

CustomAttribute.Name: ContactWireHeight
CustomAttribute.Description: The contact wire height (cwh) [m] denotes the orthogonal distance from the plane formed by the top-of-rails to the contact wire clamp.

CustomAttribute.Name: SystemHeight
CustomAttribute.Description: The cantilever system height (sh) [m] denotes the vertical Z coordinate difference from the contact wire clamp to the catenary clamp.

CustomAttribute.Name: WireClampOffset
CustomAttribute.Description: The wire clamp offset (wco) [m] denotes the distance to a sideways neutral clamp posision. The wco is positive for offsets to the right side of the alignment in the direction of increasing mileage.

CustomAttribute.Name: CatenaryClampOffset
CustomAttribute.Description: The catenary clamp offset (cco) [m] denotes the distance to a sideways neutral clamp posision. The cco is positive for offsets to the right side of the alignment in the direction of increasing mileage.

CustomAttribute.Name: StitchWireLength
CustomAttribute.Description: The stitch wire length (swl) [m] denotes the length, measured as a difference in mileage, from start to end (where it attaches to the catenary wire). Zero length means 'no stitch wire'.

CustomAttribute.Name: Stagger
CustomAttribute.Description: Stagger [m] denotes the distance from contact wire clamp to centre track, measured co-linearly with the top-of-rails plane. Positive stagger means pushing away from mast, negative means pulling towards mast.

CustomAttribute.Name: StaggerDisplay
CustomAttribute.Description: The stagger value, as shown next to the cantilever [cm].

LuaFunction.Name: _EH_UTL_code()
LuaFunction.Description: Obtains the 'code' for this OCS cantilever. Uses relation 'Tilhører kl-mast' to access the related object's data.
LuaFunction.Formula: function _EH_UTL_code() s = "Tilhører kl-mast/hengemast_i_åk" r,n = RC__getCollectionOfRelatedObjects(s) if n == 0 then return "UNFINISHED - Relate with 'Tilhører kl-mast/hengemast_i_åk' to an OCS mast." else return r[0].code,_info("Cantilever belongs to mast "..RC__identify(r[0])) end end

CustomAttribute.Name: AddVisual2dAngularOffset
CustomAttribute.Description: The 'AddVisual2dAngularOffset' [Double] adds 16.7 decimal degrees to the 2D symbol's angle. Cantilevers mounted in a yoke or galley will not be visible unless the 2D symbol is given an extra angle.

CustomAttribute.Name: mc_OcsSystemHeight
CustomAttribute.Description: Check that cantilever system height (sh) [m] conforms to Technical Regulations for the chosen Variant / SubVariant.

LuaFunction.Name: _EH_UTL_chkSystemHeight()
LuaFunction.Description: Checks the cantilever's height as a function of selected OCS system variant's min and max heights.
LuaFunction.Formula: function _EH_UTL_chkSystemHeight() min = _EH_UTL_StandardValues(Variant)["shmin"] max = _EH_UTL_StandardValues(Variant)["shmax"] sh = SystemHeight v = Variant if sh < min then return string.format("%.02f: WARNING - system height is below %s limit (%.02f).",sh,v,min),_warning elseif sh > max then return string.format("%.02f: WARNING - system height is above %s limit (%.02f).",sh,v,max),_warning else return string.format("%.02f: OK - system height is within %s limits [%.02f-%0.2f].",sh,v,min,max),_ok end end

LuaFunction.Name: _EH_KLK_code()
LuaFunction.Description: Obtains the 'code' for this OCS contact wire clamp. Uses relation 'Tilhører utligger' to access the related object's data.
LuaFunction.Formula: function _EH_KLK_code() s = "Tilhører utligger" r,n = RC__getCollectionOfRelatedObjects(s) if n == 0 then return "UNFINISHED - Relate with '"..s.."' to a cantilever." else return "",_info("Contact wire clamp belongs to cantilever "..RC__identify(r[0])) end end

LuaFunction.Name: _EH_KLK_ReferenceMileage()
LuaFunction.Description: Returns contact wire clamp's reference mileage, equal to its cantilever's reference mileage.

LuaFunction.Name: _EH_KLK_DistanceToAlignment()
LuaFunction.Description: Obtains the 'DistanceToAlignment' for this OCS contact wire clamp. Uses relation 'Tilhører utligger' to access the related object's data.
LuaFunction.Formula: function _EH_KLK_DistanceToAlignment() s = "Tilhører utligger" r,n = RC__getCollectionOfRelatedObjects(s) if n == 0 then return 0,_info("UNFINISHED - Relate with '"..s.."' to a cantilever.") else cwh = r[0].ContactWireHeight zigzag = r[0].Stagger if Alignment == nil then return 0,_warning,_info("UNFINISHED - own alignment must be assigned.") end ai = getAlignmentInfo() if not ai.NormalProjectionExists then return 0,_warning,_info("UNFINISHED - object is misplaced wrt own alignment.") end h = ai.Cant -- The track's superelevation in millimeters cr = ai.CantRotation -- CW or CCW return 0,_info("TODO: Lua code for this property is not yet ready for use.") end end

SymbolDefinition.BlockNameFormat: NO-BN-2D-JBTKL-KRAFTAVLASTING-FOR-BARDUN {% if Variant == 'Enkel' %}ENKEL {% elsif Variant == 'Dobbel' %}DOBBEL {% else %}BAD_VARIANT {% endif %}

LuaFunction.Name: _FE_DIV_ocs_annotation_name()
LuaFunction.Description: Obtains the 'name' for a OCS annotation item.
LuaFunction.Formula: function _FE_DIV_ocs_annotation_name() local RelationName = "Er KL-annotering for anything" local r,n = RC__getCollectionOfRelatedObjects(RelationName) if Variant:match("felt") then if n == 0 then return "UNFINISHED - Relate OCS contact wire change annotation to its two catenary wire alignments with '" ..RelationName.."'." elseif n == 1 then return "UNFINISHED - Relate OCS contact wire change annotation for contact wire '" ..r[0].code.."' to one more catenary wire alignment with '"..RelationName.."'." elseif n == 2 then -- NB! The user should use the ManageProperties Relations tab and just drag-and-drop relations in -- the datagrid to modify the sequence of relations (which modifies the text shown in modelspace). local a = r[0] local b = r[1] if (Variant == "Vekslingsfelt annotering") then return "VEKSLINGSFELT".." L"..a.code.." / L"..b.code elseif (Variant == "Seksjonsfelt annotering") then return "SEKSJONSFELT".." L"..a.code.." / L"..b.code elseif (Variant == "Sugefelt annotering") then return "SUGEFELT".." L"..a.code.." / L"..b.code end else return _warning,"Too many ["..n.."] related items - relate OCS contact wire change annotation to exactly two catenary wire alignments with '" ..RelationName.."', or adjust stage settings using layer names." end elseif Variant:match("Fritekst") then if code ~= nil and code ~= "" then return code else if n == 0 then return "UNFINISHED - Relate OCS annotation with variant '"..Variant.."' to its items with '" ..RelationName.."' and define the 'code' or 'name' property." else local s,i s = RC__identify(r[0]) for i = 1, n-1 do s = s..", "..RC__identify(r[i]) end return "UNFINISHED - Define the 'code' property or change the 'name' property to annotate related items ["..s.."]." end end else return _error,"Bad variant ["..Variant.."] - cannot annotate items" end end

LuaFunction.Name: NOBN_ocs_getTensioningStandardValues()
LuaFunction.Description: Returns a standard tensile force (tf) values table: [cwtf]=contact wire tf, [catf]=catenary tf, [swtf]=stitch wire tf, [awtf]=anchor wire tf. See NO-BN TRV.
LuaFunction.Formula: function NOBN_ocs_getTensioningStandardValues(os) if os == nil then OcsSystem = "Unknown" end local OcsSystems = { "Unknown", "S20A", "S20AR", "S20B", "S20BR", "S20C1", "S20C2", "S25", "S35", "S35MS", "Cariboni" } --(20C1 and 20C2 use the same tensile forces) local TensileForces = { ["Unknown"] = {cwtf=0, catf=0, swtf=0, awtf=0}, ["S20A"] = {cwtf=10, catf=10, swtf=2.3, awtf=10}, ["S20AR"] = {cwtf=7.06, catf=7.06, swtf=2.3, awtf=10}, ["S20B"] = {cwtf=10, catf=10, swtf=0, awtf=10}, ["S20BR"] = {cwtf=7.06, catf=7.06, swtf=0, awtf=10}, ["S20C1"] = {cwtf=13, catf=13, swtf=2.3, awtf=10}, ["S20C2"] = {cwtf=13, catf=13, swtf=2.3, awtf=10}, ["S25"] = {cwtf=15, catf=15, swtf=2.8, awtf=10}, ["S35"] = {cwtf=7.06, catf=7.06, swtf=0, awtf=10}, ["S35MS"] = {cwtf=7.06, catf=7.06, swtf=0, awtf=10}, ["Cariboni"] = {cwtf=13, catf=13, swtf=0, awtf=13} } --TODO: Code does not work when more than 10 items in table! Lua is fishy here: -- if not RC__isMemberOf(OcsSystems,os) then -- return TensileForces.Unknown,_warning,_info("Bad tensioning device OCS System ["..os.."]. ") -- end return TensileForces[os] end

LuaFunction.Name: _EH_AEH_dir()
LuaFunction.Description: Obtains the 'dir' for this OCS tensioning device, related to its alignment's direction.
LuaFunction.Formula: function _EH_AEH_dir() if Alignment == nil then return "unknown",_info("UNFINISHED: Own Alignment (contact wire) undefined for OCS tensioning device.") else return RC__getDistance2D(Alignment.RcAlignment.StartPoint) < RC__getDistance2D(Alignment.RcAlignment.EndPoint) and "up" or "down" end end

LuaFunction.Name: _EH_AEH_code()
LuaFunction.Description: Obtains the 'code' for this OCS tensioning device, related to its wire with 'Avspenner kontaktledning'.
LuaFunction.Formula: function _EH_AEH_code() if Alignment == nil then return _warning,"UNFINISHED: Own Alignment (contact wire) undefined for OCS tensioning device." else if Variant:lower():match("fix") then local RelationName = "Avspenner kontaktledning" local r,n = RC__getCollectionOfRelatedObjects(RelationName) if n == 0 then return "UNFINISHED - Relate fixpoint tensioning device with its catenary wire alignments with '" ..RelationName.."'." else return r[0].code end else return Alignment.code end end end

LuaFunction.Name: _EH_AEH_name()
LuaFunction.Description: Obtains the 'name' for this OCS tensioning device, related to its wire with 'Avspenner kontaktledning'.
LuaFunction.Formula: function _EH_AEH_name() if Variant:match("Fix") then return "L"..code .. " - [FIX]" elseif Variant:match("Fjær") then return "L"..code .. " - [FJ]" elseif Variant:match("Fast") then return "L"..code .. " - [F]" elseif Variant:match("Lodd") then return "L"..code .. " - [L]" else return "Unknown tensioning device variant ["..Variant.."].", _warning end end

LuaFunction.Name: _EH_AEH_Model3dName()
LuaFunction.Description: Obtains the 3D Model Name for this OCS tensioning device.
LuaFunction.Formula: function _EH_AEH_Model3dName() t = "NO-BN-3D-EH-AEH-AVSPENNING" if Variant:match("Fix") then return t.."-FIXPUNKT" else if Variant:match("Fjær") then t = t.."-FJÆR" elseif Variant:match("Fast") then t = t.."-FAST" elseif Variant:match("Lodd") then t = t.."-LODD" end if Variant:match("enkel") then return t.."-ENKEL" elseif Variant:match("dobbel") then return t.."-DOBBEL" end end return _info("Bad tensioning device variant ["..Variant.."].") end

CustomAttribute.Name: OcsSystem
CustomAttribute.Description: The OCS System is one of [Unknown | S20A | S20AR (redusert) | S20B | S20BR | S20C1 | S20C2 | S25 | S35 | S35MS | Cariboni].

CustomAttribute.Name: TensileForce
CustomAttribute.Description: The tensile force/forces (tf) exerted on the tensioning device [kN].

CustomAttribute.Name: TensileForceDisplay
CustomAttribute.Description: The tensile force value, as shown close to the tensioning device [kN].

LuaFunction.Name: _EH_AEH_TensileForces()
LuaFunction.Description: Obtains the tensile forces for this OCS tensioning device, of OcsSystem type The OCS System is one of [Unknown | S20A | S20AR (redusert) | S20B | S20BR | S20C1 | S20C2 | S25 | S35 | S35MS | Cariboni].
LuaFunction.Formula: function _EH_AEH_TensileForces(os) tf = NOBN_ocs_getTensioningStandardValues(os) if os == "Unknown" then return "?/? kN (UNFINISHED - unknown OcsSystem)" elseif Variant:match("Fix") then return tf.awtf.." kN (fix)" else if Variant:match("Fjær") or Variant:match("Fast") or Variant:match("Lodd") then return tf.cwtf.."/"..tf.catf.." kN" end end return _info("Bad tensioning device variant ["..Variant.."].") end

SymbolDefinition.BlockNameFormat: NO-BN-2D-JBTKL-AVSPENNING {% if Variant == 'Fixpunkt' %}FIXPUNKT {% elsif Variant == 'Fastavspenning, enkel' %}FAST-ENKEL {% elsif Variant == 'Fastavspenning, dobbel' %}FAST-DOBBEL {% elsif Variant == 'Loddavspenning, enkel' %}LODD-ENKEL {% elsif Variant == 'Loddavspenning, dobbel' %}LODD-DOBBEL {% elsif Variant == 'Fjæravspenning, enkel' %}FJAER-ENKEL {% elsif Variant == 'Fjæravspenning, dobbel' %}FJAER-DOBBEL {% else %}BAD_VARIANT {% endif %}
